option_string: Why have you come to see us today?
How can I help you today?
Which side do you feel the pain on?
Has the pain gotten better or worse since it started?
How would you describe the pain?
How would you rate the pain out of 10?
Have you had this pain before?
Does the pain radiate or go anywhere else?
What other symptoms do you have?
What do you believe is causing your symptoms?
How are your symptoms impacting you?
What are you expectations from our consultation today?
What are you most concerned about?
Do you have a stiff neck?
Are there any changes to your vision?
Do lights make your pain worse?
Do you have a runny nose?
Has anyone around you been sick recently?
Have you been in contact with anyone sick?
Do you have any chest pain?
Do you feel short of breath?
Do you feel like your heartbeat is abnormal?
Do you have pain in your legs when you walk?
Do you feel short of breath when you lie down?
Do you wake up at night gasping for breath?
Have you had a seizure before?
Have you coughed up any blood?
Have you coughed up any sputum?
Do you have a sore throat?
Do you feel any pain when you chew?
Do you have any medical conditions?
Do you have high blood pressure?
Have you had any surgeries in the past?
Are your immunisations up to date?
Are you taking any regular medications?
Are you taking any over the counter medications?
Do you use any recreational drugs?
Do you have any allergies, and what reactions do you get?
How much alcohol do you drink?
How long have you smoked for?
How many cigarettes a day do you or did you smoke?
Do any conditions run through the family?
Where do you live at the moment?
Who do you live with at the moment?
What are do you usually eat day to day?
Examine the visual fields with a confrontation test.
Examine the fundus with an ophthalmoscope.
Examine visual acuity with a Snellen chart.
Examine the muscles of facial expression.
Examine the power of the arms.
Examine the power of the legs.
Examine the sensation over the arms.
Examine the sensation over the legs.
Examine the mental state of the patient.
